Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 779 Filed 08/22/22 Page 11 of 101
M6SQmax1

1 credible trial testimony established that the defendant took
2 steps to make Jane comfortable and encouraged her to engage in
3 illegal sex acts with Epstein.
4
5 Paragraphs 39 to 45 which describe specific conduct
6 involving Kate, I think the specific request here -- well,
7 first, was that it should be removed from the PSR because Kate
8 was not a victim of the crimes charged in the indictment, and
9 then, alternatively, that it be moved to a different paragraph
10 with a heading offense behavior not part of relevant conduct.
11 I don't see that this is necessary. I overrule the objection.
12 Conduct involving Kate may be considered at sentencing her
13 testimony revealed additional details of the defendant's method
14 of identifying and introducing to Epstein young girls for
15 sexualized massages. Her testimony also established the
16 defendant's knowledge of the sexualized nature of massages with
17 Epstein.
18 Paragraph 43, the defendant contends this paragraph
19 should include a sentence that Kate was above the age of
20 consent at all times. I think the paragraph says that Kate was
21 age 17 or above at all relevant times, and I have no objection
22 to including that she was above the age of consent at all times
23 based on the trial evidence, so I will make that change to
24 paragraph 43 of the PSR.
25 Paragraph 54, the defendant objects that there's no
26 evidence that Epstein paid for Annie's trip to Thailand. That

SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C.
(212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00014758
